key_title: Key to species of Althenia in Victoria

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Potamogetonaceae

leads.lead_text: Leaves tapering distally; margin minutely serrulate distally; stigma peltate, c. 1.5- 2 mm wide with margin entire
Leaves ± same width throughout; margin entire and smooth; stigma ± obliquely funnel-shaped, 0.2–0.6 mm wide with margin entire or deeply fringed (in A. bilocularis)
Stigma deeply and narrowly divided, hence 'feathery'; stamen with a single 2-locular anther
Stigma with margin entire and smooth to irregular; androecium ('stamen') with a 6-locular anther mass
Mature fruit longer than subtending scales and extending beyond the leaf-sheath, pedicel elongated after fertilization
Mature fruit shorter than subtending scales and usually not extended beyond the leaf-sheath, pedicel remaining short
Plants monoecious with female flowers clustered together with male flowers; stigma c. 0.2 mm wide; leaf auricles 0.9–1.4 mm long
Plants dioecious with female flowers occurring singly some distance from each other; stigma 0.3–0.5 mm wide; leaf auricles 1.5–2.5 mm long
Leaf auricles 2–2.5 mm long; pedicels at anthesis elongated to 10–15 mm long; stigma c. 0.3–0.5 mm wide
Leaf auricles 1.5–1.8 mm long; pedicels at anthesis elongated to c. 2.5 mm long; stigma 0.2–0.3 mm wide
